title: Course on Strengthening Practical Social Problem-Solving Competencies Using Hybrid Flexible Learning Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in high-level project execution, with foundational competencies in analyzing social issues (understanding of history/geography/economics/politics)
context.additional_context: In-service practitioners integrate self-directed learning and field application in digital environments while balancing work and study. Focuses on case studies of civic engagement and institutional approaches for solving local community issues.

learning_goals: Learners will understand 80% or more of pre-learning content for solving social issues through flipped learning in a hybrid environment and score 75+ points on quiz assessments.
Learners will analyze real-world social issues (e.g., local economy, cultural conflicts, civic engagement) twice or more using action learning and propose actionable solutions.
Learners will improve their creative problem-solving ability for social issues by 30% or more compared to pre-assessment through a four-week process.

Learners will develop a flexible learning plan combining three online (MOOC) courses (e.g., social systems, economic principles, cultural diversity) and two offline field studies (local institution visits, case studies) over two weeks, submit two case examples applying this strategy to a portfolio, and meet four or more of five evaluation criteria.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
